item.title: Report E-2024080023
item.description:
Report E-2024080023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: DAWSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 24, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 tipped over in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew collected the damaged drums in two (2) 55-gallon drums. HES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean up the impacted areas and collected them in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080005
item.description:
Report E-2024080005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 arrived damaged. As a result, approximately 1/4 gallon of product released to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted trailer. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area, then deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3266 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-galon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024070115
item.description:
Report I-2024070115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: Atlanta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At ATL, on. 7/05/2024, Delta Dangerous Goods management was notified of a minor leak of a steel drum that contained Class 9, UN 3082(Environmentally Hazards Substance, Liquid). The package was found Ieaking near the base upon delivery to the gate. This event is under investigation. ,

item.title: Report E-2024070378
item.description:
Report E-2024070378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: CEDARTOWN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Thursday, July 4th, 2024, at 1057 hours, CSX personnel operating the L81004 observed GATX 5618, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, in the train, was leaking from the protective housing. The car was held by the CSX train crew on the Main Line at MP SGC 621 outside of Rockmart GA for further investigation. The shipper, GEO Specialty Chemicals Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-07-04-00063). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line closure cap less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the liquid line cap to secure the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Dan Parker, GEO Logistics Manager, 404-782-1699). The car was released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024070748
item.description:
Report E-2024070748

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents and cleaners to remediate the site. All waste was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.
